issue.title: Python API Documentation
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-346](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-346). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
It would be useful to have API documentation somewhere.  A minimal page on readthedocs might suffice and be cheap to maintain.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-346?focusedCommentId=15591941) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
We already have a scaffold for this but are not pushing the built docs anywhere. `[~wesmckinn]` can you set the readthedocs up (as I'm not a committer)?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-346?focusedCommentId=15635643) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
Minimal API documentation on RTD is up: https://pyarrow.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

Yet only manually triggered, will have to make an infra ticket to get to hooked up automatically.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-346?focusedCommentId=15693559) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
It seems like you're unable to show API documentation on readthedocs with Cython modules. In the FAQs, they suggest to mock the cython dependencies but doing that ends in a segfault of python for me locally.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-346?focusedCommentId=15693626) by Matthew Rocklin (mrocklin):*
Read the docs also provides experimental support for conda environments.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-346?focusedCommentId=15735737) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Issue resolved by pull request 228
<https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/228>
